description: HNZ | Te Whatu Ora Request-Context header schema definition

userIdentifier.description: For a human interaction, this MUST be userid of the user as authenticated by the PMS/health application (e.g. a local PMS identifier). For a system interaction, this must be the oAuth client id of the system making the request.

userRole.description: For a human interaction, this MUST be the role of the user of the PMS/health application, either "PROV" (Provider) or "PAT" (Patient). For a system interaction, this must be 110150 (Application). See https://www.hl7.org/fhir/R4/valueset-participation-role-type.html

secondaryIdentifier.description: For a human interaction, this should be the end users Common Person Number (aka HPI Practitioner identifier) of the practitioner using the application, when available.

purposeOfUse.description: The purpose of use for the data returned by this request. For a description of the purpose of use codes, see https://fhir-ig.digital.health.nz/auditevents/ValueSet-purposeofuse.html

userFullName.description: For a human interaction, this should be the full name of the user of the PMS/health application. For a system interaction, this should be the name of the application making the request.

orgIdentifier.description: HPI Organisation identifierfor the facility of user of the PMS/health application

facilityIdentifier.description: HPI identifier for the facility of user of the PMS/health application
